body_html:
@MansMeg For R interface, there are two possible solutions:

(1) SWIG, used in shogun (https://github.com/shogun-toolbox/shogun)

(2) Rcpp, used in mxnet (https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/tree/master/R-package), which is also a deep learning platform

As I understand, the core part is in C++ and that's why I said it shouldn't be hard. I am part of Rcpp team, so I know it is quite easy to call C++ from R.

But there is much more work between calling tensorflow from R and building a useful interface, right?

But there is much more work between calling tensorflow from R and building a useful interface, right?
body:
@MansMeg For R interface, there are two possible solutions:

(1) SWIG, used in shogun (https://github.com/shogun-toolbox/shogun)

(2) Rcpp, used in mxnet (https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/tree/master/R-package), which is also a deep learning platform

As I understand, the core part is in C++ and that's why I said it shouldn't be hard. I am part of Rcpp team, so I know it is quite easy to call C++ from R.

But there is much more work between calling tensorflow from R and building a useful interface, right?
